item.description: AWS Cloud Health Dashboard Download Official Project Plan (Docx) 1. item.title: 3. Translated Blogs
item.description: This section will list and introduce the blogs that I have translated. Blog 1 - Implementing DevSecOps Ecosystem for Amazon Connect at NatWest. NatWest implemented Amazon Connect with a full DevSecOps ecosystem to power a large-scale, multi-team contact center. Instead of multiple instances, they ran a single shared Connect instance but separated environments across AWS accounts for dev, test, pre-prod, prod, and DR — improving control, security, and stability. Infrastructure was managed through modular Terraform, letting teams deploy independently while enforcing consistent naming, tagging, and security standards. For faster delivery, they built export-import CI/CD pipelines for Amazon Lex bots and QuickSight dashboards instead of writing everything as IaC. Security was multi-layered, combining preventive guardrails (modules, SCPs, static scanning) and detective controls (Config, Inspector, CloudWatch, Security Hub). They also developed utilities to export contact flows as Terraform, manage Contact Lens rules, and generate performance insights. The result: faster development, more reliable releases, stronger security, and a standardized way to operate Amazon Connect across the organization.

item.title: 6. Self-Evaluation
item.description: During my internship at AWS Vietnam (September – December 2025), I had the opportunity to explore cloud computing in depth while building and documenting a practical learning project. I approached each task sincerely, researching carefully, understanding concepts before applying them, and prioritizing correctness over rushing. Across the 12 weeks, I steadily expanded my abilities in AWS services, backend development, cloud optimization, DevOps, and security engineering. The internship helped me form a structured technical mindset and improved my confidence in working with real cloud infrastructure.

item.title: 7. Sharing and Feedback
item.description: Personal Feedback – AWS First Cloud Journey (FCJ) During my time in AWS Vietnam under the First Cloud Journey (FCJ) program, I experienced a learning environment that challenged me, accelerated my growth, and pushed me beyond the typical student-level knowledge. FCJ rewards those who are self-driven. I believe it is an exceptional program, but not universally easy. It benefits students who come with curiosity, resilience, and the willingness to learn through action rather than instruction. People like me, who enjoy exploring deeply and independently, will grow extremely fast here.
